doc.after: Hillsboro's Department of Parks and Recreation operates more than 20Â facilities, including Hillsboro Stadium. There are 23Â parks, two sports complexes, the Walters Cultural Arts Center, the Shute Park Aquatic & Recreation Center, and three other mixed-use facilities.[114] The city also owns the Jackson Bottom Wetlands Preserve along the Tualatin River on the south side of the community.[115][116] South of city is Bald Peak State Scenic Viewpoint, which is day-use only, and is the closest state park to Hillsboro. L.L. "Stub" Stewart Memorial State Park is the closest full-service state park.
